alice.tuprolog

Class FamilyClausesIndex<K extends java.lang.Comparable<? super K>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • alice.tuprolog.RBTree<K,java.util.LinkedList<ClauseInfo>>
      • alice.tuprolog.FamilyClausesIndex<K>

  •  class FamilyClausesIndex<K extends java.lang.Comparable<? super K>>
extends RBTree<K,java.util.LinkedList<ClauseInfo>>
    FamilyClausesIndex enables family clauses indexing in ClauseDatabase.
    Since:
    2.2
    Author:
    Paolo Contessi

      • insert

        public void insert(K key,
          ClauseInfo clause,
          boolean first)
        Creates a new entry (key) in the index, relative to the given clause. If other clauses is associated to key first parameter is used to decide if it is the first or the last clause to be retrieved.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the index
        clause - The value to be binded to the given key
        first - If the clause must be binded as first or last element

      • remove

        public void remove(K key)
        Removes all clauses related to the given key
        Parameters:
        key - The key

      • removeShared

        public void removeShared(ClauseInfo clause)

      • get

        public java.util.LinkedList<ClauseInfo> get(K key)
        Retrieves all the clauses related to the key
        Parameters:
        key - The key
        Returns:
        The related clauses
